title: Spack can't fetch libgd, url handling seems to be problematic
body:
libgd won't build, it fails trying to fetch the library (for all three versions in the package.py).

```
[hartzelg@lb093login spack]$ spack install libgd
==> Installing libgd
==> libtiff is already installed in /home/hartzelg/tmp/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/libtiff-4.0.6-g7gpsqww4hfkg5tg4nr5izmc2sj76c2z
==> [...]
==> pkg-config is already installed in /home/hartzelg/tmp/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/pkg-config-0.29.1-ld3i7xv7jtacp7nt7k3aimjleiiuhpdg
==> Fetching https://github.com/libgd/libgd/releases/download/2.2.4/lib2.2.4.tar.gz

curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
==> Fetching from https://github.com/libgd/libgd/releases/download/2.2.4/lib2.2.4.tar.gz failed.
```

Here's the URL from the package.py:

```python
    url      = 'https://github.com/libgd/libgd/releases/download/gd-2.2.4/libgd-2.2.4.tar.gz'
```

Note that the url in `package.py` contains this bit: 

```
.../download/gd-2.2.4/libgd...
```
but the URL that's being fetched looks like this: 

```
.../download/2.2.4/lib2...
```

In particular, the one being fetched is lacking the `gd-` in two places.

Ring any bells?
